titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Wiktor Sukiennicki papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kayla Anderson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-06-14T16:31-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Collection inventoried and rehoused by Kayla Anderson.

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, correspondence, notes, reports, radio broadcast transcripts, and printed matter relating to twentieth-century Polish history, the history of the Communist International, and Radio Free Europe broadcasting to Poland. Includes draft and finished reports of the Polish Rada Ministrów, 1946, relating to the Katyn Forest Massacre and Polish prisoners of war in the Soviet Union during World War II.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Wiktor Sukiennicki papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Polish-American historian and political scientist; research analyst, Radio Free Europe, 1952-1959.
Sukiennicki, a Polish legal scholar and later a research fellow at the Hoover Institution, was the principal investigator of the Katyn Forest Massacre on behalf of the Polish government in exile.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Speeches and writings, correspondence, notes, reports, radio broadcast transcripts, and printed matter relating to twentieth-century Polish history, the history of the Communist International, and Radio Free Europe broadcasting to Poland. Includes draft and finished reports of the Polish Rada Ministrów, 1946, relating to the Katyn Forest Massacre and Polish prisoners of war in the Soviet Union during World War II.
The collection's original order and folder titles have been maintained.

did.unittitle: "Facts and Documents Concerning Polish Prisoners of War Captured by the U.S.S.R. During the 1939 Campaign," Council of Ministers,
"Facts and Documents Concerning Polish Prisoners of War Captured by the U.S.S.R. During the 1939 Campaign," Council of Ministers, English translation proof,
"The Mass Murder of Polish Prisoners of War in Katyn," Council of Ministers,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A short report based on "Facts and Documents Concerning Polish Prisoners of War Captured by the U.S.S.R. During the 1939 Campaign," published by the Council of Ministers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes three volumes of handwritten and typed notes from an unknown publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials include copies of printed notes found on victims' bodies from the Katyn massacre and depositions from surviving officers.

did.unittitle: Research studies, Wiktor Sukiennicki, list of publications,
"East Central Europe During World War I : From Foreign Domination to National Independence," typescript,
"East Central Europe...," typescript in Polish, footnotes,
"During the Russian German War," typed essay,
"November 1917, Revolution and the Peace of Brest," typed essay,
"Last Phases of World War I," typed essay,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Handwritten notes, typed essays, a resume, and other documents related to Sukiennicki’s academic career at the Hoover Institution.

did.unittitle: "East Central Europe...," bibliographic and other material,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes handwritten notes, chapter outlines, and footnotes from an unknown publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biographical materials, including a resume, biography, publication list, work timeline, and articles related to Sukiennicki's academic achievements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes expense reports, balance sheets, profit and loss accounts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Written by Maciej Siekierski, curator of the European Collections at the Hoover Institution Library & Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous items include article clippings, pamphlets printed in Polish, typescripts, newsletters, and correspondence. A small portion of the materials relate to Sukiennicki's academic career at the Hoover Institution.

did.unittitle: Radio Free Europe (RFE) Polish Desk programs, Munich,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes typed radio program transcripts and handwritten notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes printed booklets in English, Polish, and Russian. Subject matter relates to France, Poland, and Russia at the beginning of World War II and American diplomatic relations with Soviet Socialist Republics.

did.unittitle: Institute for the Study of the USSR reports,
Correspondence, R.F.E., trip to the USA,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Handwritten notes, typescripts, newspaper clippings and pamphlets from Droga, Nad Odrą i Bałtykiem, and Nowogródek. Materials relate to Khrushchev’s accession to power following Stalin’s death and include other post-World War II politics in Europe and America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes copies of book excerpts about the Russian Revolution and the Paris Peace Conference. Printed in English, Russian, French, and German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, typescripts, and handwritten notes related to Poland during World War II.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes typescripts, essays, notes, and book excerpts relating to the Paris Peace Conference and the political aftermath in Russia and Germany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of book excerpts regarding the rise of communism and fascism during the years before World War II. Printed in English, French, German, and Polish.

did.unittitle: "The Baltic Countries, Lithuania and the Ukraine after Brest," typescript,
Comintern, Fascism in 1920s Italy, march on Rome 1922,
International communist movement in the 1920s, papers, typescripts,
Soviet periodicals, topics related to Poland,
Soviet Union, internal and external politics,
Abramovich, Mensheviks and Socialist international, parts I and II,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes material from Arms of Valor and The Communist Party: An Outline of History. Also includes additional excerpts from unknown publications. Printed in English and Polish.

did.unittitle: Articles, Polish-Soviet War (as published by Bellona),
London, Ministry of Justice, Poland post-war judicial system,
Polish émigré press, includes Communist publication,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Publications include Równośc-Egalite, Robotnik, Tydzień Polski and Dziennik Polski.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes typed excerpts from various unknown publications covering the Jewish population in Poland.

did.unittitle: "The Comitern and Fascism in the Early Twenties," Wiktor Sukiennicki, typed essay,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a copy of New Poland that covers the new draft constitution of the Polish People's Republic and two article clippings from unknown publications.

did.unittitle: Plany obozów i historia Starobielsk i Ostaszków,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Short reports covering Polish prisoners of war captured by Russia during the 1939 campaign, excerpts about the Sikorski-Mayski agreentment in 1941, and a copy of the official report from the United States concerning the need for a committee to conduct an investigation into the Katyn Massacre.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Naprzod ku zwyciestwu, zołnierze-Słowianie, k brat'yam ugnetennym slavyanam, and Słowianin. Printed booklets cover Slavic soldiers in World War II, the Polish Committee of Slavic London, and the Slavic Congress in Moscow.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a chapter excerpt written by Sukiennicki and a typescript, both printed in Polish and related to the history of Polish prisoners in the Soviet Union at the end of World War II.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relates to the Katyn Massacre and includes investigations, reports, memoranda, essays, book excerpts, and research notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, typescripts, and photographs related to Sukiennicki, in Polish and English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes typed bibliographies, correspondence, and an article written by Sukiennicki published in Kwartalnik Historyczny.

did.unittitle: Polish collection at Hoover Institution Archives,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes photocopied excerpts from Revue d'études comparatives est-ouest and article clippings from Tydzien Polski and Dziennik Polski.
